elements.content: A doubly interpenetrated metal–organic framework [Cu2L­(DMF)­(H2O)]·DMF·H2O (ZJU-199, ZJU = Zhejiang University; H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrytic acid; DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been successfully synthesized. The resulting ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3·g–1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.
elements.clean_text: A doubly interpenetrated metal-organic framework [Cu2L(DMF)(H2O)]⋅DMF⋅H2O (ZJU-199, ZJU = Zhejiang University; H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrytic acid; DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been successfully synthesized. The resulting ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3⋅g-1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.

elements.content: A doubly interpenetrated metal−organic framework [Cu2L­(DMF)­(H2O)]·DMF·H2O (ZJU-199) has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3·g−1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.
elements.clean_text: A doubly interpenetrated metal-organic framework [Cu2L(DMF)(H2O)]⋅DMF⋅H2O (ZJU-199) has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3⋅g-1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.

elements.content: Acetylene (C2H2) is one of the most important raw chemicals in the petrochemical and electronic industries. However, some impurities like CO2 and CH4 degrade tremendously the significance of C2H2. So, it is essential to separate C2H2 from the mixture gas containing CO2 and CH4. Over the past few decades, more and more researchers have paid attention to metal–organic frameworks (MOFs), the hybrid porous materials of inorganic metal and organic ligands widely applied to catalysis, sensing, laser, drug delivery, and gas storage and separation. In fact, a large number of MOFs have been reported for methane and acetylene storage, carbon dioxide capture, as well as CO2/N2 and hydrocarbon separation.
elements.clean_text:
Introduction

Acetylene (C2H2) is one of the most important raw chemicals in the petrochemical and electronic industries. However, some impurities like CO2 and CH4 degrade tremendously the significance of C2H2. So, it is essential to separate C2H2 from the mixture gas containing CO2 and CH4. Over the past few decades, more and more researchers have paid attention to metal-organic frameworks (MOFs), the hybrid porous materials of inorganic metal and organic ligands widely applied to catalysis, sensing, laser, drug delivery, and gas storage and separation. In fact, a large number of MOFs have been reported for methane and acetylene storage, carbon dioxide capture, as well as CO2/N2  and hydrocarbon separation.

elements.content: Among these examples of gas storage and separation, C2H2/CO2 separation is a quite challenging task due to the molecule shapes and sizes. In fact, although a number of MOFs have been reported for C2H2/CH4 separation, far fewer examples of MOFs have been discovered for C2H2/CO2 separation. During our research on porous MOFs for gas storage and separation, we have developed a new organic linker of H3BTTA (H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrylic acid, ), an expanded H3BTC, and thus synthesized its first MOF ZJU-199 [Cu2L­(DMF)­(H2O)]·DMF·H2O. Single X-ray crystallographic study shows that ZJU-199 has the expected tbo topology in which the common paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 secondary building units (SBUs) were linked with organic linker L3– to form a three-dimensional porous structure. Although this new organic linker L3– is larger than BTC3– and the other two similar linkers we had developed before, ZJU-199 is a doubly interpenetrated MOF, so the pores within ZJU-199 are significantly reduced compared with HKUST-1, and ZJU-35 and -36. Furthermore, the open metal site density of ZJU-199 is much higher than those in HKUST-1 and ZJU-35 and -36. These two unique features enable ZJU-199 to be a suitably porous material for gas separation. Herein we report the structure of ZJU-199, its permanent porosity, and its potential for the separation of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 at room temperature.
elements.clean_text: Among these examples of gas storage and separation, C2H2/CO2 separation is a quite challenging task due to the molecule shapes and sizes. In fact, although a number of MOFs have been reported for C2H2/CH4 separation, far fewer examples of MOFs have been discovered for C2H2/CO2 separation. During our research on porous MOFs for gas storage and separation, we have developed a new organic linker of H3BTTA (H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrylic acid, ), an expanded H3BTC, and thus synthesized its first MOF ZJU-199 [Cu2L(DMF)(H2O)]⋅DMF⋅H2O. Single X-ray crystallographic study shows that ZJU-199 has the expected tbo topology in which the common paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 secondary building units (SBUs) were linked with organic linker L3- to form a three-dimensional porous structure. Although this new organic linker L3- is larger than BTC3- and the other two similar linkers we had developed before, ZJU-199 is a doubly interpenetrated MOF, so the pores within ZJU-199 are significantly reduced compared with HKUST-1, and ZJU-35 and -36. Furthermore, the open metal site density of ZJU-199 is much higher than those in HKUST-1 and ZJU-35 and -36. These two unique features enable ZJU-199 to be a suitably porous material for gas separation. Herein we report the structure of ZJU-199, its permanent porosity, and its potential for the separation of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 at room temperature.

elements.clean_text: 1  Organic Linker H3BTTA Used to Construct ZJU-199

elements.content: The organic linker, H3BTTA, was successfully synthesized by Heck cross-coupling reactions according to the reported work. Reactions of Cu­(NO3)2·2.5H2O with H3BTTA in the solvothermal condition formed the transparent cyan block crystals, ZJU-199. The structure of the as-synthesized compound has already been determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis, and the phase purity has been further confirmed by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and elemental analysis (EA).
elements.clean_text:
Results and Discussion

The organic linker, H3BTTA, was successfully synthesized by Heck cross-coupling reactions according to the reported work. Reactions of Cu(NO3)2⋅2.5H2O with H3BTTA in the solvothermal condition formed the transparent cyan block crystals, ZJU-199. The structure of the as-synthesized compound has already been determined by single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis, and the phase purity has been further confirmed by powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and elemental analysis (EA).

elements.content: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis indicates that ZJU-199 crystallizes in the R3̅c space group, the same as the well-known PCN-14, and different from the common NbO-type frameworks, which all crystallize in the space group R3̅m. The underlying topology of ZJU-199 is a (4,3)-coordinated network of tbo framework, composed of paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 SBUs (a) as the site of four- coordination, and with H3BTTA linkers as the site of three-coordination, thus forming a doubly interpenetrated three-dimensional (3D) framework. The independent framework of ZJU-199 is analogous to HKUST-1 and ZJU-35 and -36, containing three distinct cuboctahedral cages (b). The diameters of these types of cages are around 17.6 Å, 16.0 Å, and 7.8 Å, respectively. These three types of cages are interconnected at windows with a diameter of approximately 8.4 and 7.2 Å (c and d), respectively. There are numbers of water and DMF molecules coordinated with Cu atoms, directly located in the axial positions. It is expected that the axial solvent molecules can be readily removed to generate the open Cu2+ sites, established before, for gas sorption. The overall framework is a doubly interpenetrated one, existing as three-dimensional intersecting channels of about 4.7 × 7.8 Å (e), 8.0 × 8.4 Å (f), and 4.0 × 8.4 Å (g), respectively.
elements.clean_text: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction analysis indicates that ZJU-199 crystallizes in the R3̅c space group, the same as the well-known PCN-14, and different from the common NbO-type frameworks, which all crystallize in the space group R3̅m. The underlying topology of ZJU-199 is a (4,3)-coordinated network of tbo framework, composed of paddle-wheel dinuclear Cu2(COO)4 SBUs (a) as the site of four- coordination, and with H3BTTA linkers as the site of three-coordination, thus forming a doubly interpenetrated three-dimensional (3D) framework. The independent framework of ZJU-199 is analogous to HKUST-1 and ZJU-35 and -36, containing three distinct cuboctahedral cages (b). The diameters of these types of cages are around 17.6 Å, 16.0 Å, and 7.8 Å, respectively. These three types of cages are interconnected at windows with a diameter of approximately 8.4 and 7.2 Å (c and d), respectively. There are numbers of water and DMF molecules coordinated with Cu atoms, directly located in the axial positions. It is expected that the axial solvent molecules can be readily removed to generate the open Cu2+ sites, established before, for gas sorption. The overall framework is a doubly interpenetrated one, existing as three-dimensional intersecting channels of about 4.7 × 7.8 Å (e), 8.0 × 8.4 Å (f), and 4.0 × 8.4 Å (g), respectively.

elements.content: X-ray single crystal structure of ZJU-199 indicating that (a) each tricarboxylate ligand connects with three paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 clusters to compose the independent framework and the resulting twofold interpenetrated framework; (b) the cages of the independent framework; (c) and (d) the resulting frameworks without the consideration of the framework interpenetration; the pore channels of the doubly interpenetrated framework (e) of about 4.7 Å × 7.8 Å; (f) of about 8.0 Å × 8.4 Å; and (g) of about 4.0 Å × 8.4 Å in diameter viewed from different directions (C, gray and violet; O, red; Cu, blue; H atoms are omitted for the clarity).
elements.clean_text: 1  X-ray single crystal structure of ZJU-199 indicating that (a) each tricarboxylate ligand connects with three paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 clusters to compose the independent framework and the resulting twofold interpenetrated framework; (b) the cages of the independent framework; (c) and (d) the resulting frameworks without the consideration of the framework interpenetration; the pore channels of the doubly interpenetrated framework (e) of about 4.7 Å × 7.8 Å; (f) of about 8.0 Å × 8.4 Å; and (g) of about 4.0 Å × 8.4 Å in diameter viewed from different directions (C, gray and violet; O, red; Cu, blue; H atoms are omitted for the clarity).

elements.content: In view of its crystal nature, we explored the permanent porosity of ZJU-199. The acetone-exchanged ZJU-199 was evacuated at 273 K for 2 days and at room temperature for 5 h under high vacuum to yield the activated ZJU-199a. The PXRD analysis reveals that the activated crystal material still retains its crystalline structure, and the peaks of ZJU-199 and ZJU-199a are mainly consistent with the simulated one (Figure S3). The permanent porosity of ZJU-199a was evaluated by N2-gas sorption at 77 K. Nitrogen sorption isotherm of ZJU-199a indicates typical Type-I sorption behavior, confirming its microporous nature, and the pore size distribution is quite consistent with the aforementioned crystal structure (). The saturation N2 physisorption reaches 353.2 cm3·g–1, and the corresponding pore volume is 0.55 cm3·g–1. Thus, the Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas were estimated to be 987 m2·g–1 and 1532 m2·g–1, respectively.
elements.clean_text: In view of its crystal nature, we explored the permanent porosity of ZJU-199. The acetone-exchanged ZJU-199 was evacuated at 273 K for 2 days and at room temperature for 5 h under high vacuum to yield the activated ZJU-199a. The PXRD analysis reveals that the activated crystal material still retains its crystalline structure, and the peaks of ZJU-199 and ZJU-199a are mainly consistent with the simulated one (Figure S3). The permanent porosity of ZJU-199a was evaluated by N2-gas sorption at 77 K. Nitrogen sorption isotherm of ZJU-199a indicates typical Type-I sorption behavior, confirming its microporous nature, and the pore size distribution is quite consistent with the aforementioned crystal structure (). The saturation N2 physisorption reaches 353.2 cm3⋅g-1, and the corresponding pore volume is 0.55 cm3⋅g-1. Thus, the Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas were estimated to be 987 m2⋅g-1 and 1532 m2⋅g-1, respectively.

elements.content: (a) N2 sorption isotherms of ZJU-199a at 77 K. Closed symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption. (b) Pore size distribution of ZJU-199a.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) N2 sorption isotherms of ZJU-199a at 77 K. Closed symbols, adsorption; open symbols, desorption. (b) Pore size distribution of ZJU-199a.

elements.content: We examined the ZJU-199a for the selective separation of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4. The low-pressure sorption measurements of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 were performed at 273 and 296 K, respectively (). ZJU-199a systematically adsorbs much more C2H2 than CO2 and CH4. At 296 K and 1 atm, the C2H2 uptake amount of ZJU-199a is 128.0 cm3·g–1, which is much higher than those of CO2 (62.4 cm3·g–1) and CH4 (14.4 cm3·g–1) under the same conditions (b). Similarly, at 273 K and 1 atm, the C2H2 uptake amount of ZJU-199a is 169.5 cm3·g–1, much higher than the amounts of CO2 (119.0 cm3·g–1) and CH4 (25.3 cm3·g–1) (a). It is worth noting that the C2H2 uptake of ZJU-199a (128.0 cm3·g–1) is much higher than those of other MOFs for hydrocarbon or C2H2/CO2 separations (48.0 cm3·g–1 in ZJNU-61, 72.5 cm3·g–1 in FJI-C4, 80.0 cm3·g–1 in [Zn2(NH2–BTB)­(2-nim)], 64 cm3·g–1 in {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8]­(H2O)10(DMA)2} n , 51.8 cm3·g–1 in ZJU-30a, and 70.1 cm3·g–1 in UTSA-68a) ().

At 296 K and 1 atm, the C2H2 uptake amount of ZJU-199a is 128.0 cm3⋅g-1, which is much higher than those of CO2 (62.4 cm3⋅g-1) and CH4 (14.4 cm3⋅g-1) under the same conditions (b). Similarly, at 273 K and 1 atm, the C2H2 uptake amount of ZJU-199a is 169.5 cm3⋅g-1, much higher than the amounts of CO2 (119.0 cm3⋅g-1) and CH4 (25.3 cm3⋅g-1) (a). It is worth noting that the C2H2 uptake of ZJU-199a (128.0 cm3⋅g-1) is much higher than those of other MOFs for hydrocarbon or C2H2/CO2 separations (48.0 cm3⋅g-1 in ZJNU-61, 72.5 cm3⋅g-1 in FJI-C4, 80.0 cm3⋅g-1 in [Zn2(NH2-BTB)(2-nim)], 64 cm3⋅g-1 in {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8](H2O)10(DMA)2} n , 51.8 cm3⋅g-1 in ZJU-30a, and 70.1 cm3⋅g-1 in UTSA-68a) ().

elements.content: Single-component adsorption isotherms for C2H2 (violet), CO2 (orange), and CH4 (blue) of ZJU-199a at 273 K (a) and 296 K (b), respectively.

As is well-known, Ideal Adsorbed Solution Theory (IAST) was carried out to estimate the adsorption selectivity for the binary C2H2/CO2 (50:50, v/v) and C2H2/CH4 (50:50, v/v). a,b expresses the IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-199a at 273 and 296 K, respectively. At 296 K, the C2H2/CH4 selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the range of 27.3 to 33.5, lower than that of FJI-C4 (51.0) but significantly higher than that of ZJNU-61 (9.9), {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8]­(H2O)10(DMA)2} n (9.6), [Zn2(NH2–BTB)­(2-nim)] (5.0 to 18.0), and ZJU-30a (9.58); and the C2H2/CO2 selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the range of 4.0 to 5.8, slightly higher than UTSA-68a (3.5 to 5) and significantly higher than {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8]­(H2O)10(DMA)2} n (3.4) and ZJU-30a (1.7 to 2.4), featuring ZJU-199a as the potential candidate for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation (b). In addition, the selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the ranges of 40.0 to 62.7 for C2H2/CH4 and 4.0 to 8.8 for C2H2/CO2 at 273 K, respectively, which are quite high as well (a).
elements.clean_text: As is well-known, Ideal Adsorbed Solution Theory (IAST) was carried out to estimate the adsorption selectivity for the binary C2H2/CO2 (50:50, v/v) and C2H2/CH4 (50:50, v/v). a,b expresses the IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-199a at 273 and 296 K, respectively. At 296 K, the C2H2/CH4 selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the range of 27.3 to 33.5, lower than that of FJI-C4 (51.0) but significantly higher than that of ZJNU-61 (9.9), {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8](H2O)10(DMA)2} n  (9.6), [Zn2(NH2-BTB)(2-nim)] (5.0 to 18.0), and ZJU-30a (9.58); and the C2H2/CO2 selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the range of 4.0 to 5.8, slightly higher than UTSA-68a (3.5 to 5) and significantly higher than {[Co6(μ3-OH)4(Ina)8](H2O)10(DMA)2} n  (3.4) and ZJU-30a (1.7 to 2.4), featuring ZJU-199a as the potential candidate for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 separation (b). In addition, the selectivity of ZJU-199a lies in the ranges of 40.0 to 62.7 for C2H2/CH4 and 4.0 to 8.8 for C2H2/CO2 at 273 K, respectively, which are quite high as well (a).

elements.content: (a) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-199a at 273 K. (b) IAST calculations of C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 adsorption selectivity for ZJU-199a at 296 K. (c) Isosteric heats of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 adsorption, Qst, in ZJU-199a.

elements.content: Except for the high selectivity of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separation, the necessary stability of ZJU-199 still needs to be verified. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) demonstrated the satisfactory thermostability of ZJU-199, with no decomposition of framework occurring up to at least 240 °C (Figure S1), suitable enough for application.
elements.clean_text: Except for the high selectivity of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separation, the necessary stability of ZJU-199 still needs to be verified. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) demonstrated the satisfactory thermostability of ZJU-199, with no decomposition of framework occurring up to at least 240 °C (Figure S1), suitable enough for application.

elements.content: As shown in c, the heats of adsorption of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 in ZJU-199a are 38.5 kJ mol–1, 29.0 kJ mol–1, and 19 kJ mol–1, respectively. Apparently, the interaction between C2H2 and the frameworks is stronger than that of CO2 and CH4, indicating that both open metal sites and suitable pore sizes play important roles for the high selectivity separation of C2H2 over CO2 and CH4 at room temperature.
elements.clean_text: As shown in c, the heats of adsorption of C2H2, CO2, and CH4 in ZJU-199a are 38.5 kJ mol-1, 29.0 kJ mol-1, and 19 kJ mol-1, respectively. Apparently, the interaction between C2H2 and the frameworks is stronger than that of CO2 and CH4, indicating that both open metal sites and suitable pore sizes play important roles for the high selectivity separation of C2H2 over CO2 and CH4 at room temperature.

elements.content: In summary, we have designed and synthesized a new organic linker and thus a novel doubly interpenetrated metal–organic framework, ZJU-199. With high density of open metal sites and suitable pore sizes, the activated ZJU-199a takes a much higher amount of C2H2 uptake than those of CO2 and CH4, exhibiting highly selective separation for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 at room temperature. Although a large number of organic linkers have been explored, the rich organic chemistry might still provide us with other useful organic linkers to construct porous metal–organic frameworks for their diverse applications in the near future.
elements.clean_text:
Conclusions

In summary, we have designed and synthesized a new organic linker and thus a novel doubly interpenetrated metal-organic framework, ZJU-199. With high density of open metal sites and suitable pore sizes, the activated ZJU-199a takes a much higher amount of C2H2 uptake than those of CO2 and CH4, exhibiting highly selective separation for C2H2/CO2 and C2H2/CH4 at room temperature. Although a large number of organic linkers have been explored, the rich organic chemistry might still provide us with other useful organic linkers to construct porous metal-organic frameworks for their diverse applications in the near future.

cln_elements.content: A doubly interpenetrated metal–organic framework [Cu2L­(DMF)­(H2O)]·DMF·H2O (ZJU-199, ZJU = Zhejiang University; H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrytic acid; DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been successfully synthesized. The resulting ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3·g–1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.
cln_elements.clean_text: A doubly interpenetrated metal-organic framework [Cu2L(DMF)(H2O)]⋅DMF⋅H2O (ZJU-199, ZJU = Zhejiang University; H3BTTA = benzene-1,3,5-triacrytic acid; DMF = N,N-dimethylformamide) has been successfully synthesized. The resulting ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3⋅g-1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.

cln_elements.content:
A doubly interpenetrated metal−organic framework [Cu2L­(DMF)­(H2O)]·DMF·H2O (ZJU-199) has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3·g−1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.

In view of its crystal nature, we explored the permanent porosity of ZJU-199. The acetone-exchanged ZJU-199 was evacuated at 273 K for 2 days and at room temperature for 5 h under high vacuum to yield the activated ZJU-199a. The PXRD analysis reveals that the activated crystal material still retains its crystalline structure, and the peaks of ZJU-199 and ZJU-199a are mainly consistent with the simulated one (Figure S3). The permanent porosity of ZJU-199a was evaluated by N2-gas sorption at 77 K. Nitrogen sorption isotherm of ZJU-199a indicates typical Type-I sorption behavior, confirming its microporous nature, and the pore size distribution is quite consistent with the aforementioned crystal structure (). The saturation N2 physisorption reaches 353.2 cm3·g–1, and the corresponding pore volume is 0.55 cm3·g–1. Thus, the Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas were estimated to be 987 m2·g–1 and 1532 m2·g–1, respectively.

Except for the high selectivity of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separation, the necessary stability of ZJU-199 still needs to be verified. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) demonstrated the satisfactory thermostability of ZJU-199, with no decomposition of framework occurring up to at least 240 °C (Figure S1), suitable enough for application.
cln_elements.clean_text:
A doubly interpenetrated metal-organic framework [Cu2L(DMF)(H2O)]⋅DMF⋅H2O (ZJU-199) has been successfully synthesized. ZJU-199 exhibits moderate C2H2 uptake of 128.0 cm3⋅g-1 and high selectivity for separation of C2H2/CH4 (27.3 to 33.5) and C2H2/CO2 (4.0 to 5.8) at room temperature.

In view of its crystal nature, we explored the permanent porosity of ZJU-199. The acetone-exchanged ZJU-199 was evacuated at 273 K for 2 days and at room temperature for 5 h under high vacuum to yield the activated ZJU-199a. The PXRD analysis reveals that the activated crystal material still retains its crystalline structure, and the peaks of ZJU-199 and ZJU-199a are mainly consistent with the simulated one (Figure S3). The permanent porosity of ZJU-199a was evaluated by N2-gas sorption at 77 K. Nitrogen sorption isotherm of ZJU-199a indicates typical Type-I sorption behavior, confirming its microporous nature, and the pore size distribution is quite consistent with the aforementioned crystal structure (). The saturation N2 physisorption reaches 353.2 cm3⋅g-1, and the corresponding pore volume is 0.55 cm3⋅g-1. Thus, the Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) and Langmuir surface areas were estimated to be 987 m2⋅g-1 and 1532 m2⋅g-1, respectively.

Except for the high selectivity of C2H2/CH4 and C2H2/CO2 separation, the necessary stability of ZJU-199 still needs to be verified. Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) demonstrated the satisfactory thermostability of ZJU-199, with no decomposition of framework occurring up to at least 240 °C (Figure S1), suitable enough for application.

decomposition_temperature.type: gradual removal of coordinated water molecules

cln_elements.clean_text: 1  Organic Linker H3BTTA Used to Construct ZJU-199

cln_elements.content: X-ray single crystal structure of ZJU-199 indicating that (a) each tricarboxylate ligand connects with three paddle-wheel Cu2(COO)4 clusters to compose the independent framework and the resulting twofold interpenetrated framework; (b) the cages of the independent framework; (c) and (d) the resulting frameworks without the consideration of the framework interpenetration; the pore channels of the doubly interpenetrated framework (e) of about 4.7 Å × 7.8 Å; (f) of about 8.0 Å × 8.4 Å; and (g) of about 4.0 Å × 8.4 Å in diameter viewed from different directions (C, gray and violet; O, red; Cu, blue; H atoms are omitted for the clarity).

metadata.title:
Doubly Interpenetrated Metal–Organic Framework
for Highly Selective C2H2/CH4 and
C2H2/CO2 Separation at Room Temperature
